result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald S Wild

records.addlTxt:
3:35 PM Defendant Ronald S Wild in court, in custody from the St. Croix County Jail.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Ronald S Wild.  Attorney Lucas D Arras in court for State of Wisconsin. A. Standaert - Clerk 

22CF382, 22TR4953, 22TR4954, 22TR5087

State - calls Deputy Adam Zukowski who is sworn in and testifies
Deputy Adam Zukowski identifies deft
3:40pm - Atty Rivard - to cross, asks prior record spoken to by Deputy Adam Zukowski be stricken
State - makes argument
Atty Rivard - makes further argument
Court - record will not be stricken, takes judicial notice of complainant
Deputy Adam Zukowski is excused as witness
State - makes argument, asks Court to find probable cause and bind deft over for trial
Atty Rivard - no argument for today
Court - finds probable cause and binds deft over for trial
Arraignment scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Order to Transport for Court on October 21, 2022 at 3:30 PM
No possession or consumption of alcohol. Not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores - or any establishment where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

2:30 PM Defendant Ronald S Wild in court, in custody from the St. Croix County Jail, without counsel.  Attorney Andrew John Maki in court for State of Wisconsin. A. Standaert - Clerk 

22CM57, 22CF382, 22TR4953, 22TR4954, 22TR5087

Deft - would like counsel for INIT for 22CF382
Court - will reschedule

SEHR for 22CM57
Court - speaks to deft's right to counsel
Deft - waives counsel for SEHR
State - makes argument

2:37pm - Attorney Jonathan Lundeen now appears by Zoom

State - continues argument, asks for 90 days jail with credit for 61 days - concurrent to any other sentence
Atty Lundeen - asks for Huber privileges
Deft - makes statement to the Court
Court - orders deft to 90 days jail with credit for 61 days credit - concurrent to any other sentence, Huber allowed

INIT for 22CF382
State - asking for $500 sign bond - No possession or consumption of alcohol. Not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores - or any establishment where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 
Atty Lundeen - no objection
Court - orders $500 sign bond - No possession or consumption of alcohol. Not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores - or any establishment where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 
Atty Lundeen - waives reading, asking for speedy prelim
Court - schedules speedy prelim for 10/31 at 3:30
Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
No possession or consumption of alcohol. Not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores - or any establishment where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Initial appearance on October 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on November 15, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Initial appearance on October 11, 2022 at 10:25 am.
